title: Plugins
description: Nuxt Kit provides a set of utilities to help you create and use plugins. You can add plugins or plugin templates to your module using these functions.

children.value: Plugins are self-contained code that usually add app-level functionality to Vue. In Nuxt, plugins are automatically imported from the
directory. However, if you need to ship a plugin with your module, Nuxt Kit provides the
methods. These utils allow you to customize the plugin configuration to better suit your needs.
Registers a Nuxt plugin and to the plugins array.
Watch Vue School video about addPlugin.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight

children.value: A plugin object or a string with the path to the plugin. If a string is provided, it will be converted to a plugin object with
set to the string value. If a plugin object is provided, it must have the following properties:
, the plugin will be included in both client and server bundles. If set to
, the plugin will only be included in the server bundle. If set to
, the plugin will only be included in the client bundle. You can also use
option to use plugin only in client or server side.
Order of the plugin. This allows more granular control over plugin order and should only be used by advanced users. Lower numbers run first, and user plugins default to
-plugins (plugins that run before Nuxt plugins) and
unless you know what you're doing. For most plugins, the default
is sufficient. To append a plugin to the end of the plugins array, use the
Options to pass to the plugin. If
, the plugin will be appended to the plugins array instead of prepended.

children.value: Adds a template and registers as a nuxt plugin. This is useful for plugins that need to generate code at build time.
Watch Vue School video about addPluginTemplate.

props.className: language-ts shiki shiki-themes material-theme-lighter material-theme-lighter material-theme-palenight
props.code:
function addPluginTemplate (pluginOptions: NuxtPluginTemplate, options: AddPluginOptions): NuxtPlugin

interface NuxtPluginTemplate<Options = Record<string, any>> {
  src?: string,
  filename?: string,
  dst?: string,
  mode?: 'all' | 'server' | 'client',
  options?: Options,
  getContents?: (data: Options) => string | Promise<string>,
  write?: boolean,
  order?: number
}

interface AddPluginOptions { append?: boolean }

interface NuxtPlugin {
  src: string
  mode?: 'all' | 'server' | 'client'
  order?: number
}
